title: Performance Marketing Manager
description:
ABOUT RETOOL:  Nearly every company in the world runs on custom business software: Gartner estimates that up to 50% of all code is written for internal usage. This is the operational software for refunding orders underwriting loans moderating content managing marketplaces rolling out new features onboarding employees analyzing transactions providing customer support…the list is nearly endless. For most companies building and maintaining all of these tools demands a lot of engineering time—scarce expensive resources better put to use on customer-facing products. At Retool we’re designing a new type of development environment that makes it dramatically faster and easier to build all of this software. Retool unifies the ease of visual programming with the power of code while abstracting away the tedious and repetitive tasks of development. We believe that the future of software development lies in being a force multiplier for developers and technical builders helping them move considerably faster and build a lot more software.  It’s akin to a new version of Visual Basic HyperCard or Flash—with a bit of Figma and some future-of-programming vibes thrown on top. Today our customers span from small startups building their first operational tools to Fortune 500 companies building mission-critical apps for thousands of users across their business. Why were looking for you Retool is the fast way to build internal tools. Thousands of companies—like Brex DoorDash and Pinterest—use Retool to build custom apps that help them manage drivers approve loans and run any process that gets business done. We’ve grown exponentially each year since being founded but need help reaching millions more developers. That’s where you come in. As the performance marketing manager at Retool you’ll create and execute our paid ads marketing strategy build campaigns to accelerate our pipeline and scale marketing channels while promoting our product and content efforts. We’re a fast-paced startup with plenty of room to experiment and create immediate impact from your work. You’ll get to wear different hats and work across many teams at Retool.  What youll do You’ll own plan execute and manage all performance marketing initiatives at Retool including but not limited to paid ads and programmatic advertising. You will play a key role driving Retool’s continued growth and success on all online ads channels. Success in this role will require deep experience in performance marketing a drive for continuous improvement and desire to drive real value to Retool’s customers and prospects. No two days will be the same. As part of a rapidly scaling team you will have the opportunity to assist in various other areas of demand generation and growth. Who youll work with You’ll be working with almost every Retool but will most often be partnering with marketers designers finance and go-to-market teams to execute on marketing campaigns at scale. We really like spending time with each other in person and believe in the power of in-person collaboration creativity and connection so we have returned in a hybrid capacity to our San Francisco offices 3 days a week.  In this role youll:  Build scale and optimize online paid ads channels like Google Ads Bing Ads LinkedIn Ads Meta Ads Recommend strategise and incorporate additional paid ads platform from to further Retool’s online acquisition strategy Run experiments to improve success metrics across programs and campaigns Create campaigns targeting every stage of the demand funnel to accelerate pipeline generation Evaluate and track key success metrics across all paid advertisement channels (e.g. performance ROI etc.) and provide recommendations on budget distribution across different channels campaigns and tactics Work closely with the organic growth team to balance spend and impact through the paid advertisement channels Keep the programs and campaigns efficient and build streamlined reporting processes to communicate our impact with the right stakeholders  The skill set youll bring:  5+ years of performance marketing experience with a B2B or developer tools startup 3+ years experience managing LinkedIn Ads Google Ads Meta Ads and Bing Ads 2+ years experience managing programmatic ads Experience with regional platforms like Xing Naver Baidu etc. is highly desired  Experience working with the BDR and Sales team to ensure alignment of goals and establish SLAs on handoffs Experience measuring analyzing and reporting performance of programs and campaigns and developing optimization strategies Familiarity with Salesforce and Hubspot (or other similar CRM and marketing automation tools) Excellent communication and presentation skills Strong project management skills with an ability to keeping multiple work streams and cross-functional partners and vendors in sync around timelines Strong ownership mindset to do whatever is needed to deliver the best marketing to our customers     Retool offers generous benefits to all employees. For more information please visit the benefits and perks section of our careers page! Retool is currently set up to employ all roles in the US and specific roles in the UK. To find roles that can be employed in the UK please refer to our careers page and review the indicated locations.

Because when they succeed they make a difference and when millions of small businesses are making a difference the world is a more beautiful place.
Whats the role?
As a Senior Engineer specialising in Salesforce Marketing Cloud you will be working across multiple technical projects across the Salesforce ecosystem with a focus on Marketing Cloud. You’ll work in collaboration with other team members to help create and deliver beautiful software to our customers.
You’ll undertake software application development on applications across our technology stack contributing to new or improved experiences for our customers internal and external.
You’ll contribute to our cross functional environment by working towards the same objectives using modern principles and practices.

Create software - Care deeply about customer problems and technical excellence produce robust high quality and scalable software. Relentlessly automate manual processes. Contribute to technical solution designs that embrace a quality-first approach. Participate in code reviews.

Continuous improvement - Maintain knowledge of current and emerging development technologies and methodologies. Develop expertise in one or more programming languages and ecosystem specific technologies.

Deliver infrastructure in a production environment - Maintain and monitor delivery processes. Ensure all software is running as expected and proactively work to prevent customer facing problems.

Agile software and delivery practices - Practise agile software development. Occasionally facilitate agile ceremonies. Proactively work to improve team processes. What youll bring 
Broad Salesforce Marketing Cloud experience with previous experience implementing and supporting development at enterprise sized organisations.
Advanced knowledge of Automation Studio Mobile Studio Contact Builder
Front end development experience if you have full stack or front end experience in another system and were interested in learning SFMC and Salesforce we would be interested to chat.
Salesforce certifications are highly beneficial especially those relating to development in Marketing Cloud.
Experience with Sales Cloud and other Salesforce products is desirable.Proficient use of one or more programming languages: SQL Ampscript GTL or JavaScript.
Experience using SFMC integrations via Journey builder custom activities or API.Ability to debug across the technology stack.
Confident in upgrading the tooling and technology that connects to our products.
Proficient in roll out and maintenance of cloud infrastructure.
Confident in designing and implementing new solutions in the Marketing Cloud environment.
Knowledge of Marketing Cloud’s API endpoints and the ability to install packages and connect with external data sources.Able to implement resilient software design patterns.
Able to maintain update and document team APIs.
Ability to coach and mentor engineers to develop their technical proficiency.Familiar with application and infrastructure security concerns and proactively mitigates issues.
Demonstrated ability to respond to production incidents. Critical competencies  
Growth mindset proactive positive ‘can-do’ attitude exceptionally self-motivated and directed.
Excellent oral written presentation and stakeholder management skills.
Ability to take challenges and processes to gather business requirements in a consultative manner to resolve those challenges and automate processes.
Superior analytical evaluative and problem-solving abilities with a keen attention to detail.
Strong teamwork skills and understanding of what it takes to create maintain and contribute to a high performing team culture. Experience 
5+ years hands-on experience as a Developer or Engineer with Salesforce Marketing Cloud with relevant certifications or similar experience as a full-stack or front end developer.
Experience with integrations between Salesforce and 3rd party applications.
Hold some of the following certifications: Marketing Cloud Developer Marketing Cloud Consultant Sales Cloud Consultant Platform Developer 1 Platform App Builder or other relevant certifications. Additional Information

title: Retail Space Planning Manager
description:
Gopuff is the go-to solution for immediate everyday needs fulfilling customer orders of cleaning and home products to over-the-counter medications to food and drinks and in some markets alcohol - in just minutes.As the Retail Design Manager for BevMo + Gopuff you will oversee the development and implementation of the Space Planning function for all 160+ BevMo + Gopuff locations in California Arizona and Washington. The Space Planning position will provide organization and structure for how space is utilized in each store to maximize omnichannel sales including walk-in retail sales. The position will report to the NA America Retail organization and will work cross-functionally with Merchandising Supply Chain Operations Real Estate and Marketing to design spaces within the retail stores to create an experience that exceeds the customer’s expectations while providing for an efficient operation.
In this role you will conduct an initial assessment of existing space allocation at each location develop a plan for improving the current state and implement that plan in partnership with our Merchandising and Operations teams. You will be responsible for continuously assessing and optimizing space allocation throughout the life of each facility as products categories and customer needs change. In addition to developing and operationalizing planograms for each store you will own the process of refreshing the design elements of each seasonal merchandising set.  Responsibilities:  
Develop merchandising floor plans by analyzing the performance of categories and stores analyzing space needed for merchandise from available performance data utilizing strategic merchandising objectives evaluating the customer path considering operational requirements considering fixture needs and creating detailed drawings
Manage the database utilized to account for category space allocation by establishing space by store and category capturing space changes as floor plans change evaluating requests for space changes from stores and making changes to the database as changes occur
Developing precision planogram drawings of merchandising categories by utilizing strategic category objectives analyzing item performance of existing items and projections of new items establishing items to be deleted and added to the category and evaluating space requirements 
Develop precision drawings of store-specific merchandising floor plans by analyzing store-specific facilities specifications establishing the space needs of the specific store evaluating tradeoffs of compromises required from the established prototype evaluating local customer needs and creating detailed drawings
Constantly look for ways to innovate improve and lead the market in retail design
Create the design and look/feel of each seasonal set acquire and distribute decorative elements to stores based on the displays they have Qualifications:  
Bachelors degree in Math Finance Business or a related field
4 years of experience in Retail space management
5+ years of experience in Retail Design
Experience with Space Planning Software
Experience with Retail Merchandising and Store Setup
Experience in the alcohol beverage department is a plus
Comfortable working in a fast-paced ambiguous environment with limited direction
Excellent prioritization and project management skills
Excellent communication skills and ability to work well with others
California-based candidate required
Ability to travel regularly Compensation:

A candidate’s starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills experience qualifications work location and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future. title: Senior Director, Head of Marketing - Mobile
description:
Who We Are Founded in 2005 2K Games is a global video game company publishing titles developed by some of the most influential game development studios in the world. Our studios responsible for developing 2K’s portfolio of world-class games across multiple platforms include Visual Concepts Firaxis Hangar 13 CatDaddy Cloud Chamber and HB Studios. Our portfolio of titles is expanding due to our global strategic plan building and acquiring exciting studios whose content continues to inspire all of us! 2K publishes titles in today’s most popular gaming genres including sports shooters action role-playing strategy casual and family entertainment. Our team of engineers marketers artists writers data scientists producers problem solvers and doers are the professional publishing stewards of our growing library of critically acclaimed franchises such as NBA 2K Battleborn BioShock Borderlands The Darkness Mafia PGA 2K Sid Meier’s Civilization WWE 2K and XCOM. At 2K we pride ourselves on creating an inclusive work environment which means encouraging our teams to Come as You Are and do your best work! We are dedicated to diversity and inclusion and want our community of candidates to reflect this commitment. We encourage all qualified applicants to explore our global positions. 2K is headquartered in Novato California and is a wholly owned label of Take-Two Interactive Software Inc. (NASDAQ: TTWO). What We Need  The Senior Director Head of Mobile Marketing reports to the VP & GM of Mobile and will drive the marketing vision strategy and execution for existing and new 2K mobile titles. This role supports the expanding Mobile Business Unit leading both User Acquisition and Brand Marketing pillars. A leader that is intrinsically ‘we’ vs ‘I’ cares deeply and leans into data driven insights and learnings is critical to the unit’s growth. Specifically we are looking for someone who:   Flexes expertly between the visionary mentor/coach and the tactical doer. Building relationships both within and across the team is critical as well as balancing partnerships challenging the status quo and knowing when to bring people on the journey vs driving fast change.  Has clear mastery in mobile marketing post-IDFA. You and your team are expected to know our mobile products and our competitors’ products intimately - what they do today and what they plan to do in the future. You will tie together user acquisition app store optimization brand activations and PR to develop the most compelling marketing strategies and actions.  The ideal candidate would have experience shipping and operating top grossing F2P mobile games while in a UA or Marketing role and is devoted to the success of our games and team. Key Responsibilities:    Develop a Marketing vision strategy and plan for 2K mobile game franchises that delivers commercial player and brand results aligned with short- and long-term success. Demonstrate the courage to advocate for and test innovative new approaches even when challenged by legacy ways of working.  Hire train and develop a world-class mobile marketing team. Create an environment that inspires and empowers everyone to do their best creative work and thinking.  Create launch and rollout campaigns that tie together the capabilities of different functional teams – product management UA brand marketing PR creative services and analytics.  Define strategic multi-million-dollar sustained UA campaigns from Soft Launch to Live Ops. Drive continued high-quality volume to 2K’s mobile titles optimized to return on LTV. Create a relentless culture of experimentation on existing UA channels while establishing new UA funnels. Own & manage the creative Oversee rigorous testing & experimentation processes that maximize acquisition performance. Also lead the team in the development of brand creatives (app icons screenshots trailers 1st party promo art). Work with brand and product teams on product positioning. Develop branding communications advertising promotional and PR programs over title’s lifecycle. Develop the organic vs paid media strategy for social and community. Manage the social content development calendar and our community strategy. Lead ASO – including A/B testing and optimization of our App Store Listings.    Be the expert on our players - who they are how they buy and their key buying criteria to not only input marketing strategy but product development.  Be an expert on our competition and how they are positioned to ensure we have a clear differentiation in our offerings and communications.  Who We Think Will Be a Great Fit  8+ years of performance marketing experience. Preferably shipped a Top-Grossing Mobile F2P title with demonstrated ability managing multi-million-dollar UA budgets in a post-IDFA environment. Deep knowledge and expertise in other areas of marketing – brand ASO PR social. A balance of data-driven analytical skills with demonstrated creative campaign wins. Ability to drive incremental volume from creative development and testing. A good leader with excellent communication and presentation skills. Experienced mentor of high performing teams. Experience working with and influencing teams across different disciplines and levels. Self-starter who can self-prioritize tasks and remain productive with minimal supervision.  Please note that 2K Games and its studios never uses instant messaging apps or personal email accounts to contact prospective employees or conduct interviews and when emailing only use 2K.com accounts. description:
At Braze we have found our people. We’re a genuinely approachable exceptionally kind and intensely passionate crew. We seek to ignite that passion by setting high standards championing teamwork and creating work-life harmony as we collectively navigate rapid growth on a global scale while striving for greater equity and opportunity – inside and outside our organization. To flourish here you must be prepared to set a high bar for yourself and those around you. There is always a way to contribute: Acting with autonomy having accountability and being open to new perspectives are essential to our continued success. Our deep curiosity to learn and our eagerness to share diverse passions with others gives us balance and injects a one-of-a-kind vibrancy into our culture. If you are driven to solve exhilarating challenges and have a bias toward action in the face of change you will be empowered to make a real impact here with a sharp and passionate team at your back. If Braze sounds like a place where you can thrive we can’t wait to meet you. WHAT YOU’LL DO We are seeking a hands-on detailed oriented Senior Accountant to join our growing Finance team and to help support the continued expansion of our global business. The successful candidate will be a key person on the GL team to ensure the accurate and timely closing of the monthly books and assist with the annual audits and SOX compliance.  Additionally this individual will innovate and drive efficiencies through continual evaluation of our systems and business processes. This role will report directly to the Accounting Manager and have exposure to the Senior Executives on the Corporate Accounting team.   Play an essential role in the month-end and quarter-end close processes including preparing and reviewing journal entries and supporting reconciliations Obtain and maintain a thorough understanding of the financial reporting and general ledger structure Perform monthly analytics to ensure completeness and accuracy of financial statements Coordinating and supporting statutory compliance and audits for Braze’s international entities Work with the FP&A and Accounts Payable team to ensure accurate coding of expenses Prepare monthly account reconciliations for various balance sheet accounts Coordinate with other departments to obtain transaction information research reconciling items and resolve issues Aid in the optimization of existing platforms and the use of platform such as NetSuite Assist with documentation of accounting policies and procedures that ensure all financial transactions are executed according to GAAP principles Assist with financial audits and SOX compliance Undertake other ad hoc analyses and special projects as required  WHO YOU ARE  Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance 4+ years of relevant accounting experience  Big 4 or large regional firm experience a plus CPA and/or MBA a plus International accounting experience a plus SaaS or Technology industry preferred Proven knowledge and application of US GAAP with a general understanding of SOX Highly organized and results-oriented and works well in a fast-paced environment Ability to meet tight timelines; able to manage multiple priorities Highly self-motivated detailed oriented flexible team player that is able to operate independently Solid verbal/written communication and interpersonal skills Proven proficiency of Microsoft Office and Google Workspace General understanding of NetSuite Floqast or other comparable ERP systems is preferred  For candidates based in the United States the pay range for this position at the start of employment is expected to be between $76500 and $89000/year with an expected On Target Earnings (OTE) between $90000 and $105000/year (including bonus or commission). Your exact offer may vary depending on multiple individualized factors including market location job-related knowledge skills and experience. In addition to cash compensation Braze offers full- and part- time employees a comprehensive Total Rewards package that includes equity grants of restricted stock (RSUs) so that all Braze employees own a piece of our company.  WHAT WE OFFER From comprehensive benefits to remote availability to flexible time off we’ve got you covered so you can prioritize work-life harmony.  Competitive compensation that may include equity Retirement and Employee Stock Purchase Plans Flexible paid time off Comprehensive benefit plans covering medical dental vision life and disability Family services that include fertility benefits and equal paid parental leave Professional development supported by formal career pathing learning platforms and tuition reimbursement  Community engagement opportunities throughout the year including an annual company wide Volunteerism Week  Employee Resource Groups that provide supportive communities within Braze Collaborative transparent and fun culture recognized as a Great Place to Work®   Details of these benefit plans will be provided if a candidate receives an offer of employment. Benefits may vary by location. ABOUT BRAZE Braze (Nasdaq: BRZE) is a leading comprehensive customer engagement platform that powers interactions between consumers and brands they love. With Braze global brands can ingest and process customer data in real time orchestrate and optimize contextually relevant cross-channel marketing campaigns and continuously evolve their customer engagement strategies. Braze is proudly certified as a Great Place to Work® in the U.S. the UK and Singapore.
